definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
lit. rising and lying down, working and resting (idiom)/fig. everyday life/daily routine/to go about one's daily life

sentences.english: How about tidying up a bit in the sitting-room ?
sentences.chinese: 把起居室稍微打掃一下怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Spiff the sitting room with coloured lights.
sentences.chinese: 用彩燈將起居室打扮起來。

sentences.english: Life teachers in our school take charge of students' daily life.
sentences.chinese: 學校配有生活老師，照顧學生的飲食起居。

sentences.english: Even groups of professionals are living in shared houses with no lounge, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 很多專業人士也合住沒有起居室的房子。

sentences.english: Besides, there is also a balcony next to the living room and one of the bedrooms.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，緊挨起居室和一間臥室有一個陽臺。

sentences.english: A compact sitting-room of the same genre was outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面是間具有同樣格調的小小的起居室。

sentences.english: The whole family then moves to the living room.
sentences.chinese: 接着全家人聚在起居室。

sentences.english: Immediately inside the front door was the door of his sitting room.
sentences.chinese: 緊靠前門，裏面的一扇門就是他的起居室的門。

sentences.english: It is essential to instruct patients with NIDDM in good lifestyles.
sentences.chinese: 飲食起居生活規律化是對糖尿病患者教育指導的重點。

sentences.english: No room escaped damage. The children's bedroom - the living room.
sentences.chinese: 孩子的房間，起居室，所有的房間都受到損壞。

sentences.english: She put on some overalls, GOT out the paint and started on the living-room wall.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上工作服，拿出油漆，從起居室的牆開始幹起來。

sentences.english: Fleur darted through the window into the morning room.
sentences.chinese: 芙蕾三腳兩步從窗戶進入了那間起居室。

sentences.english: South livingroom, overlooking the closure of the Terrace Garden.
sentences.chinese: 起居室朝南，封陽臺外能俯瞰中央花園。

sentences.english: There is a sofa in the livingroom.
What are you doing in the living room with your roller skates on?
sentences.chinese: 你穿着旱冰鞋在起居室幹什麼？

sentences.english: The twilight and stillness of the drawing-room seemed to increase his numbness.
sentences.chinese: 起居室裏昏暗的燈光和沉靜的氣氛使他越發顯得麻木。

definition: lit. rising and lying down, working and resting (idiom)/fig. everyday life/daily routine/to go about one's daily life
to have three meals a day
to tend/to take care of sb
clothing, food, housing and transport (idiom); people's basic needs
to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to eat, drink, shit, piss, and sleep/(fig.) the ordinary daily routine
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
